pr_title: Fix new te not been set on replacing te.

timeline.message: Fix new te not been set on replacing te.

timeline.bodyText: Wouldn't it just make more sense to check if existing != null? Or are you using the transaction as a check if we're capturing in the first place before checking if the capture had captured a tile entity to be removed?
timeline.author: gabizou

replies.bodyText:
@gabizou The capture of the removal here L434.
Affect the selection of this if expression
replies.author: ginyai

replies.bodyText: Ok so it's bundling the combined check that required the tile entity being queued for removal in the first place. Can you comment that in the change then (since tileentity == null is the only vanilla check, by adding the transaction check it's now sponge modified). I try to keep this method commented about its changes compared to the original code to avoid confusion between updates and when reading the method to see where sponge is making a change compared to the original engine code.
replies.author: gabizou
ginyai

replies.bodyText:
Edited suggestion
The suggestion sounds fine, but if you're doing a //Sponge Start, then it'd make sense to modify the later // Sponge Start since Sponge's modifications are starting earlier.
replies.author: gabizou

timeline.message: Add comments. Make the changes compared to the original code clearer.
